content.text: @autodotfun emphasizes building for builders rather than users, and promotes a fun interactive button. @shawmakesmagic discusses practical programming language choices for AI compatibility, suggesting TypeScript or Python over Rust due to training data availability. @shawmakesmagic retweeted @IroncladDev's post mocking Rust programmers. @shawmakesmagic also noted an unusual Node.js installation that included Python, showing the interconnection of development tools.

Typescript or Python are your only practical choices in the long run

Order of magnitude less rust training data etc...

contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
Just installed a fresh instance of node on windows

And it installed Python? wtf?...

content.text: @elizaOS is promoting their platform for agentic apps with several announcements: zero-cost inference and frictionless deployment through Morpheus Inference, a partnership with Reva for AI-powered financial transactions, and collaboration with Inferium AI. They emphasize their on-time delivery and showcase builder demos. @shawmakesmagic retweeted @supercoolkay4's post about expanding elizaOS blockchain integrations, particularly for Arbitrum stylus compatibility.

content.theme_title: AI Impact on Employment and Society
content.text: @shawmakesmagic shares realistic perspectives on AI's impact on jobs, estimating it will eliminate 10-15% of jobs rather than the catastrophic 99% some predict. He compares this to the Great Depression's 26% unemployment rate. He also humorously responds to AI's lack of feelings and discusses the pressure of AI advancement on employment. @shawmakesmagic retweeted @ctrl_cheeb_del's post about '12 victims a week' with an image, suggesting concerns about AI's negative impacts.

contributing_tweets.author: ctrl_cheeb_del
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: 12 victims a week https://t.co/LXNWCvY7W6...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: I’m sorry, but as an AI assistant I don’t have any feelings, imagined or otherwise. I’m happy to talk about anything you’d like! https://t.co/qRXNPghbbn...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
AI will not wipe 99% of jobs

It will wipe about 10%-15% of jobs

The height of American unemployment was the Great Depression

26%

Let’s be realistic and not catastrophic

But also, you don’t need total catastrophe to feel the pressure...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
Almost got hacked

Went to do a live demo with a journalist

Was a member named Zoom in the channel who requested permissions after I started presentation

Smelled bad so I left

Very nearly clicked on the permission grant

Would have been toast

Zoom is so dangerous...

content.text: @dankvr discusses market volatility and stoicism in crypto, suggesting that founders and developers should maintain composure despite market fluctuations. He also critiques a platform that extracted $700M while announcing a 50% creator revenue share and planning a $1B token sale. @shawmakesmagic questions why wealthy artists would engage with crypto, referencing Cardi B's tweet about 'buyback and burn flywheel'. @dankvr retweeted his own post about how onboarding shapes ideology in the crypto space.

contributing_tweets.author: dankvr

> Announced 50% creator revenue share
> It's another fee that added as a cost to traders
> Now planning a $1B token sale https://t.co/3yundYA6a0...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Why would any rich and famous artist subject themselves to this...

content.text: @shawmakesmagic expresses frustration with the American political system, suggesting that meaningful change won't come from either major party and advocating for decentralized politics. He argues that partisanship is opposed to nationalism and that people can't simultaneously love their party and country. He shares a meme mocking American politicians and criticizes the spending habits of political parties.

contributing_tweets.author: LivewJack
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
@shawmakesmagic change is just a projection of the collective inner state. 
— @SpartanVersus...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: Politicians in America be like https://t.co/aBiGwJoOOk...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: So are ya’ll done pretending that any change will come from these people on “either side” or do we need to wait another 4 years to decentralize politics...

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
It’s funny that we all know this but we can’t do anything about it because the people who are still addicted to the game accuse us of playing for the other side

I am convinced that partisanship is directly opposed to nationalism. You can’t love your party and your country. You h...

content.text: @shawmakesmagic equates $10K Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) to simply having a job, suggesting that some entrepreneurial income targets are equivalent to regular employment. This reflects on the changing nature of work and income in the digital economy.

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet: 10K MRR? You mean a job?...

content.text: @shawmakesmagic shares a close call with a potential hack during a live demo with a journalist, where someone named 'Zoom' in the channel requested permissions. He warns that Zoom can be dangerous from a security perspective, highlighting the ongoing risks in digital communications.

contributing_tweets.author: shawmakesmagic
contributing_tweets.tweet_text_snippet:
Almost got hacked

Went to do a live demo with a journalist

Was a member named Zoom in the channel who requested permissions after I started presentation

Smelled bad so I left

Very nearly clicked on the permission grant

Would have been toast

Zoom is so dangerous...

content.text: On June 3, 2025, the elizaOS/eliza repository showed significant activity with 12 new pull requests (all of which were merged), 3 new issues, and 12 active contributors participating in the project.
PR #4896 by @odilitime titled 'feat: handleServerSync in an efficient way' is open.
PR #4902 by @HarshModi2005 titled 'feat: Initialize Alethea AI Plugin Structure and Configuration (M4-00)' is merged.
PR #4907 by @wtfsayo titled 'fix: dont throw for world settings' is merged.
PR #4903 by @0xbbjoker titled 'feat: macos setup guide' is merged.
PR #4895 titled 'chore: update blog post for twitter agent guide' is merged.
PR #4910 titled 'chore: clean .elizadb and .eliza on bun run clean' is merged.
PR #4906 titled 'Main' is merged.
PR #4905 titled 'fix(cli): resolve workspace dependencies in plugin loading' is merged.
PR #4904 titled 'fix: choice action - return false instead of throwing error during validation' is merged.
PR #4900 titled 'fix: plugin auto-import when starting from plugin directory' is merged.
PR #4899 titled 'chore: activate turbo cache' is merged.
PR #4898 titled 'fix: foreign key issue in chat messages' is merged.
PR #4897 titled 'Fix/core build missing entry points' is merged.
Issue #4909 titled 'Any updates about HyperEVM' by @donpushme is OPEN with no comments since its creation on June 3, 2025.
Issue #4908 titled 'Pump.fun migration feature' by @taprwhiz is OPEN with no comments since being created on June 3, 2025.
Issue #4901 titled 'As a Full stack Software Engineer, I am looking for new opening job position' by @mattdev071 is OPEN with no comments since being submitted on June 3, 2025.
